titleStmt.title: The proceedings in the House of Commons, touching the impeachment of Edward, late Earl of Clarendon, Lord High-Chancellour of England, Anno 1667 with the many debates and speeches in the House, the impeachment exhibited against him, his petition in answer thereto : as also the several weighty arguments concerning the nature of treason, bribery, &c. by Serj. Maynard, Sir Ed. S., Sir T.L., Mr. Vaughan, Sir Rob. Howard, Mr. Hambden [sic], and other members of that Parliament : together with the articles of high-treason exhibited against the said Earl, by the Earl of Bristol in the House of Lords on the 10th of July, 1663 : with the opinion of all the learned judges therein.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.
Clarendon, Edward Hyde, Earl of, 1609-1674.
Vaughan, John, Sir, 1603-1674.
Seymour, Edward, Sir, 1633-1708.
Littleton, Thomas, Sir, d. 1681.
Hampden, Richard, 1631-1695.
Maynard, John, Sir, 1602-1690.
Howard, Robert, Sir, 1626-1698.
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Lords.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
